intro: Borreria senensis, commonly known as the Mexican redroot, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or red, blooming in summer, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Borreria senensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
